content:
There is an issue with Validator 1 : there is a line break after the variable [[m]]
I have correct it !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple enough cipher to complete in the fastest gameplay mode and would be interesting to write the shortest code for. Seems well explained and test cases account for shifting past the ends of the alphabet.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one !
The word "encrypt" is missing its "r" on statement's first line. Other than that, you're good to go =)
There is no test for a rotation of 0. Perhaps add such a testcase.
It could be worth explicitly stating that if the shift goes off of the alphabet in either direction that it should wrap around. Z -> A

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fairly easy problem, it could be a fun one for reverse (though I'd combine line 1 and 2 to: n=2, d=< -> d=<<)

The only potential issue as it stands is it may not explicitly state that it's shifting letter position in the alphabet, but this seems intuitive enough to me.

You have uploaded the same contribution twice. Please remove one of them.

Please follow the contribution guidelines in writing the statement.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Goal section
* You must specify all the requirements unless you enable Reverse mode as the only game mode.

Input section
* Please follow the example in the link above and split the input descriptions into different lines, with line numbers and variable types added.

Constraints section
* Please format "<" and ">" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Cases
* Please revise each pair of test and validator so that they are similar, e.g. one pair tests "<" and another pair tests ">".

* Please revise the cases so that there are two pairs testing "<" and two pairs testing ">" (to acheive uniform test coverage).

Thanks.
Thank you for your detailed feedback.  This is only my second attempt at creating something, so I really appreciate it.
I agree! That could be very fun!

Thank you for making the changes. The contribution looks better now!

Constraints section
* Please use [[n]] instead of [[N]] for consistency.

* Also, I don't think n can be 0 (i.e. no shift is done). I would suggest to change the first ≤ to <.

Goal section
* The explanation still needs to be expanded, with at least a simple description of what the rules of the cipher are. You may refer to this contribution as an example:

https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/615955355e81da150427fbc22030665ef811

Thanks again.
